p.s: California is a melting pot where white people and Hispanic cultures mix together.
Nonetheless, there is a lot of tension between those ethnic groups which is rooted in mainly racism.
California is right at the morrder to many South American countries where most undocumented immigrants come from.
Although the USA relies on those people for a functioning economy, for example in agriculture or construction, many white people are against illegal immigration, even if they profit from it.
Like in the book, many white Americans seek out illegal immigrants to do house work for them at the labour exangeexchange, since it is cheap and they don't have to pay taxes.
Many white people are not aware of the complicated system of getting citizenship in America, so they usually just dismiss the struggles of undocumented immigrants.
But they are ways to improve the situation.
One way would be to educate white people about the reasons for illegal immigration and the harsh struggles that those face who are undocumented.
Or making the process of getting citizenship or applying for assylum easier.

To summarize, racism and uneducation of mainly white people are the reason why the climate between them and Hispanics areis not so good, but learning about illegal immigration could help better the situation.
